intro: Riedlea serrata var. glabrescens, commonly known as the smooth-leafed riedlea, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its smooth, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in shaded, moist environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
